intro: Pleurothallis margaritifera, commonly known as the "pearl orchid," is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is native to the tropical regions of South America. This epiphytic plant typically grows on trees or rocks in humid, shaded environments. It features small, delicate flowers that are often white or pale pink, with a fragrant scent. The plant has a short, fleshy stem and produces pseudobulbs that store water and nutrients. Its unique appearance and delicate blooms make it a popular choice among orchid enthusiasts.
